review.title: Horrible Customer Service!!
review.reviewText: I prepaid for my room I wasn't aware of the $100 deposit nor was I informed of it when I called. I get there & the woman informs me of the deposit I let her know I was going to be back with the deposit I get back & she tells me that her coworker (whom I've never spoken to) cancelled my reservation then she tells my boyfriend that she cancelled my reservation because she wasn't sure if I was really coming back. She left the front & called security I spent almost 2hrs on the phone with Expedia because she wouldn't come to the front office to answer the phone. & Expedia booked me to a different hotel. The woman was high beyond measure because her pupils were dilated & unaware of what was really going on.

review.title: Bed bugs
review.reviewText: Room smelt of mold and had bed bugs. When I wanted to get a refund for that the night I was refused even though I couldn't stay in the room.

review.title: Aweful service had a broken tv, coffee maker.
review.reviewText: The service was very poor the coffee maker and the TV was broken in are room. The beds were so dirty that we didn't even get under the sheels. The front desk lady was very rude and this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed I wouldn't even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

review.title: Stay away!
review.reviewText: Perfect for crackheads and prostitute services. Pictures might be nice but in reality rooms are disgusting.

review.title: Felt unsafe
review.reviewText: Charged for parking that wasn't in any way secure. Loitering in the car park which we mentioned to the staff who ensured she would call but nothing happened. We were woken multiple times through the night by the noise these men were making. We both felt very unsafe and uncomfortable. Wouldn't stay there again

review.title: LOCATION IS NOT SAFE FOR FAMILIES
review.reviewText: Aggressive thugs and homeless people all around the hotel. The hotel itself is in a very poor condition. Staff is rude and non-accommodating.
review.locationRemarks: Great location but the area is not safe.

review.title: for the price it was good
review.reviewText: Room a little small but we managed. Hotel staff were great including maid service. They should think about upgrading the microwave, the carousel didn't turn anymore.

review.title: All things considered-nice hotel
review.reviewText: Except for the ground level (3 floors total) MUST negotiate stairs; elevator does not go direct to any floor. With 7 bags I had a hard time getting them to the room. Staff is knowledgeable and helpful. There is a $100 cash deposit required w/o Credit Card (debit card accepted but deposit still required). Great location for public transport and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Airport shuttle service available and very reasonable but order in advance by appointment only.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoking rooms would be great.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping of all kinds, restaurants, lounges and public transportation just outside the parking lot.

review.title: $57.00 for one local call!
review.reviewText: Before i made the call,  i read the entire contents of printed material on the cover of the room's phone,  which listed prices of calls.  Local calls - $0.50. I made one local call,  to same area code as hotel,  to a place 5 blocks away,  and hotel said they considered it long distance,  and charged me $57. After cslling Westin,  the parent company of Travelodge,  i received message thst i could pick up $25 from front desk to help with phone charges,  but that colored it as me having difficulty PAYING the charges,  which wasnt the case. The call should have cost $0.50, not $57.00. If a call within same area code isnt considered  a local call,  WHAT IS?

review.title: would not recommend
review.reviewText: Rude staff, dirty rooms, homeless wandering around everywhere

review.title: Was desperate.
review.reviewText: Had to change from a fleabag hotel to the travel lodge. Guy at the front desk was rude but the rest of the staff were lovely so it was pleasant enough.

review.title: Not hotel but motel, central to all tourists attra
review.reviewText: This place is a motel that is centrally located to most San Francisco attractions. The place needs a lot of work. Very limited parking and it looked like someone was dealing drugs from there. Saw roach by the small refrigerator

review.title: Convenient,  but also inconvenient.
review.reviewText: I wish it was closer to downtown, but its a clean, comfortable motel with all necessities in the rooms like hairdryers,  microwave,  fridge,  etc.   Id suggest it for anyone.

review.title: Your basic comfy motel
review.reviewText: Confortable,  easy-going on the check-out time,  no problems and also not remarkable.  Is a bit farther from  downtown than I prefer,  but is a good value and your basic decent hotel/motel.  No reason not to stay at Travelodge. It does the job nicely.

review.title: Worst hotel ever
review.reviewText: No parking available!  Park at your own risk!!!  Had to take everything out of car because of high break on area.   Lots of homeless people. No sleep.  Room above us was EXTREMELY NOISEY!!  Sounded like they were moving furniture, or taking a car apart ALL NIGHT!   Yikes!!!

review.title: Not the greatest but good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located conveniently however parking is $15 per day....not mentioned until we checked in.  Room is small, beds are ok, equipment is old and due for refurb.  Room stunk of paint and come to find out the edges of all the furniture were still wet with varnish!  My daughter got if all over her shirt.  It was s place to sleep but not much more.

review.title: Travel lodge
review.reviewText: I expected this to be up to travel lodge standard. It looked nothing like the pictures it showed in the room. It was old, painted gold walls and brown architrave, it was yuk. The employees (night shift) stud outside apartment door talking all night, people upstairs banged around all night so with not much sleep we found that everyone grouped outside our door waiting for breakfast door to be opened at 6.45 in the morning. Be also ready to pay an extra $17 a night to park your car - that should have been put in the price of room. Never had to pay for parking at a travel lodge before! Breakfast was a bowl of cereal or toast and a free for all. Just not good at all.
Comfortable clean and location was easy to get around the city

review.title: Didnt get what I paid for
review.reviewText: I booked 2 queens and got 2 doubles; the air conditioner didnt work in the first room and barely worked in the second. Initial desk clerk was rude about they type of credit card I used because he was unfamiliar with it. I paid $15 for parking only to find a full parking lot and no parking so I had to park on the street (with no refund). Witnessed a drug deal right out front after checking in; the only good thing was location. Not worth the price or discomfort.

review.title: Infested hotel
review.reviewText:
Horrible my girlfriend and myself ended up in the hospital after staying here.. Woke up horribly sick, with golf ball sized bites all over our body's.. 

I AM WARNING YOU DO NOT STAY HERE, THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BE CLOSED DOWN!!! 

EXPEDIA IM DISAPPOINTED YOU COULD HAVE A HOTEL FOR YOUR CUSTOMERS TO STAY IN LIKE THIS GARBAGE...

review.title: Shady
review.reviewText: Clearly you get what you pay for, we arrived at the hotel late at night and there was all kinds of shady people in the parking lot area. Rooms were not very clean, it doesn't look like they use bleach on their linen or towels. First Hotel I've been to that they actually charge $100 deposit on the credit card for the room...no I would not recommend this place to anyone unless you are in a very tight budget.

review.title: horrie experience
review.reviewText: There was prostitution in the hotel and homless people sleeping in the parking lot  cracks in the shower no bed apreads on the beds just the sheets  i had my kids with me and they were scared and unconfortable we booked 2 rooms and ended sleeping in one just a horrific experience

review.title: Clean and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to stay at if you need a last minute place to stay. Very clean and staff was friendly. Wifi was high speed which is important for any hotel to have. My complaint is that its a bit small and parking lot is small.

review.title: You get what you paid for
review.reviewText: The title says it all. I don't even know where to begin. Checking in was not pleasant what so ever. The young lady at the counter had a "what do you want" type of attitude instead of being approachable. Expedia claimed that the hotel had breakfast but I didn't see anything or was even given the time or place they'd be serving. Took a shower and the water leaked in to the bedroom. One of the beds was so uncomfortable! I could literally feel the springs of the mattress. Lastly what really upset me the most is that at check in I was not told I needed a permit from the hotel to park in their parking lot! Seriously why can't they be courteous and let they're guest know. What if my car didn't get towed or I got a citation of any sort. I will never ever go back.
Good location, but parking is difficult.  There are not as many parking places as rooms.

review.title: Scary place
review.reviewText:
Homeless  people in parking lot looking in windows of cars. Hookers coming out of rooms. Probably wouldn't stay here again. Charged $15.00 a day for parking on top of what you pay for the room.
Rooms are very old and not well maintained.
Also, breakfast should start at 6:00 AM, not 7:00 AM. People are coming to work and need to be at the site by 7:00 AM.
review.negativeRemarks: Update hotel and put in some security. If you're charging that much for the room, you shouldn't have to pay for parking.

review.title: Prostitutes, homeless, and drunks...OH MY! OH NO!!
review.reviewText:
I spent 4 sleepless nights in this hotel...why?...a drunk customer having a shouting match at 3am, prostitute in a room above me with a squeaky bed and very loud shoes, other prostitutes being very loud talking as they went to their "rooms", a loud bar across the street and a couple of loud homeless people camped out in in the parking lot acting as if it was their living room. I  know now why there were complimentary ear plugs provided in the room. I asked for a disability access room which ended up on the second floor with the elevator being out of service the entire 4 days. The floor had a puddle left from the cleaning bucket...I happened to find it with my dry slippers. The toilet wasn't secured properly and wobbled very precariously. I was afraid after the sun went down...I didn't feel safe leaving the room!

I wrote the parent company Wyndham but got a standard insincere "we're sorry" letter from the hotel manager. Wyndham did nothing! No attempt was made while I was there or via the return insincere email to make me a satisfied customer. I was told that since my booking was made through Expedia, I would have to discuss this with them! TOTALLY disgusted with my experience at Travelodge Central! I don't know how they are still in business! I will NEVER stay there again and will NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone! The star rating should be minus ten!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: I stay here because it was fairly close to UCSF. One bus and I would be right in front of the hospital.

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText: Only saving grace was the proximity to transport links. Otherwise stay away from here. Somewhat sketchy area, very noisy, traffic and people shouting. Open aspect of buildings gives no soundproofing. Yes Travelodges are basic hotels, but I have always found they are clean and cheerful. This was dingy, dark and damp and I can safely say - the worst hotel I have stayed in. Spend a little more and be a little closer to the action. Not that this was particularly cheap, as a final insult.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor, damp and if a shower curtain needs fixing.....do it. People are paying money to stay here.

review.title: Horrible place to stay
review.reviewText: Advertised as non smoking rooms when you actually get to the room, it's a completely different story.

review.title: good location but noisy
review.reviewText: The stay was great until a bug crawled on me when I was in bed.
review.negativeRemarks: more cleaner

review.title: Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: It's in a ruff area and lots transient around the parking lot
review.positiveRemarks: That it had a vacancy for the night
review.negativeRemarks: People wandering the parking lot
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Inner city motel
review.reviewText:
I thought it would be a ideal spot, it's a in a very convenient  location with parking, in SF that's good.
The moment I checked in, I wanted my money back, but no refunds.
 I prepaid the room, so I didn't expect that they still wanted a $100.00 deposit, no deposit, no room. After I paid that, they wanted $17.50 for parking, daily. When I found the room,
It did not look like a $91 room, the place smelled, like a combination of    mold and smoking. At night homeless people were around my door and in the complex. 
Never again

review.title: That is not a motel.
review.reviewText: Bad smell in the room. The room is like living outside. No privacy. Dirty room.
Room smelled of cigarettes, garbage left over from previous party. Room was hot and stuffy, ac didn't work

review.title: Horrible place! Stay away!
review.reviewText:
This was the worst place I have ever stayed at. It was always noisy. There were people loudly banging around upstairs, loud music, screaming, yelling, and fighting. The staff was very unpleasant. I called many times about the noise and it still continued. There were homeless people everywhere. I even saw a few come in for the continental breakfast. There were a few mornings where some of the breakfast items were all out. The coffee was cold. The halls smelled of urine. There was a broken remote on the ground outside from someone throwing it. It was there for over a day. There were cigarette butts all over the place, on the ground and on the outside carpet. There were quite a few prostitutes. One even went into the room next door with some guy. I had my daughter with me. Another day there was a pimp that had a room and all his girls were loitering around the hotel grounds. 
In the room, the dresser drawers were broken and we could not even get them open. All the furniture was badly scratched up. There were cigarette burns on the blankets. The lamp shades were cracked and hanging off. The fridge froze our food. The ice bucket had a crack on the bottom so water spilled out. We had to keep the drapes closed the whole time because we felt unsafe. There were shady drug deals right outside the window. The pillows were small, lumpy and cheap. There were only two plugs that we could use in the whole room and one did not hold our chargers well.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!

review.title: Nice hotel terrible area
review.reviewText: The staff was courtesy and pleasant. On the other hand, some of the people they allow in there is another story. They were up all night! Stumping, up and down the stares, talking loud, moving furniture around. And when I say all night I mean ALL NIGHT! The first night I was there a man kept trying to get into my room. We told him he had the wrong room, then he got belligerent. After three times of yelling to him wrong room, he finally realized he had the wrong room. I think he was drunk or high. Beware there is a lot of drug activity in the area. I will say, other than the staff being pleasant, the breakfast was pretty good.

review.title: Average hotel off Market Street;
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was a good price for San Francisco and it is centrally located near the Mission and Haight/Ashbury districts. Although the hotel is older, probably 70s vintage, the hotel was clean; rooms were clean;staff was friendly; many channels on TV. Hotel is adequate for a short term stay. We stayed 4 nights. However, the key cards for the room seemed to expire every day. We had to go into the office every day when we returned to our room to get the key cards updated. Fortunately the latest we returned was 8:45 pm and the office was still open. Each time the staff gave a different reason why they would not work, such as the card was too close to our cell phone (not true), the card was not in its protective sleeve (it was), and the card was too close to other magnetic surfaces (no, it was in my front pocket, in its protective sleeve). Either the staff does not know why the card malfunctions, the card machine is malfunctioning, or the cards are programmed only for 24 hours at a time for security reasons. I will give the benefit of the doubt for the last possibility, but it was a real pain in the tush; especially when needing the bathroom right away.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. A less than 10 minute walk to the 16th & Mission BART station. Large bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Every day when we returned to our room, the key cards would not work. We had to go into the office and get them re-programmed.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to public transit, including BART and Muni.

review.title: Brothel
review.reviewText: There was a prostitute walking around offering her services during the afternoon we arrived.  We paid to park in the hotel parking lot, but in the morning when we were going to leave there was a car double parked behind us.  Fortunately, we were right behind our friends so when they moved we could get out.  Their vehicle was evidently used by one of the prostitutes as a prop, because there were alcohol bottles and a used condom it front of it.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff should have kept the prostitutes off of the premises and had that double parker towed.
review.locationRemarks: The main thing to do is get out of there!

review.title: wont book here again
review.reviewText: Looks like a shady place, staff are cold. Won't go here again.

review.title: Hookers and Junkies
review.reviewText: Sleep was hard due to amount of hookers and junkies that are staying at this place. Eliminate the hookers and junkies that fight all night all drugged up and this would be an excellent place to stay. Location is perfect

review.title: Find somewhere else
review.reviewText: Creepy looking people hanging around, got a knock on the door about 2am (didn't answer it), corner room we were in smelt of urine outside.  You get what you pay for.

review.title: Horrible, dirty hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE!
review.reviewText: We stayed here because of a last minute decision. Worst decision ever. Our job smoking room reeked of stale cigarette smoke. There were sketchy looking people all around the corridors just hanging out. We had an old 90s model box style to with only 1 working channel. The bathroom was awful. It was very dirty. The ceiling above the bathtub was beginning to cave in and there was mold in the crack where it started to cave. The shower curtain rod was rigged into the wall so bad that the curtain would not close at all when used. It only gathered up in the middle. I will never be staying at any Wyndham property again.

review.title: Cockroaches in the ROOM!
review.reviewText: Cockroaches in the ROOM!  The front desk staff didn't seem to care. No need to say more.

review.title: hotel convenience
review.reviewText: Your typical travelodge but I love that you have anything you need within in little distance..

review.title: Poor location and clientelle
review.reviewText: I am basing modt of my review on it's location and the clientelle that it seemed to attract.  Being that I chose this property from far away how could I know the area and the type of people staying in the facility.  The outside at first impression is dirty.  The type of people hanging outside would deter me and others from appoaching.  The lobby as a first impression leaves little to be desired.  Fortunately, the room had been cleaned and comfortable except the noise from the aforementioned low life's who hang outside. Our first 2 nights were Fri and Sat - parties and other activities were quite disturbingly loud.

review.title: Safety is an issue with this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is not in one of the best neighborhoods. Safety is definetly a concern with this hotel, there are people drinking, smoking and loiterring outside the hotel balcony during late nights.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: This motel is centrally located from all the major attractions in San Francisco and is located close to street car and bus stops.  The rooms and clean and comfortable and it has a great continental breakfast; however, the staff was not very helpful when asking about where to located places or how to get to specific addresses.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff friendliness

review.title: Loud and looked like people doing drugs
review.reviewText: Hotel was off of a main Street so the area was kinda busy. There was a bunch of people lurking around the stairwells and balconies during the early morning hours. But the manager upon checking in was nice.

review.title: The hotel was great!!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was so clean and staff was so nice, i wish i would of stayed longer. It was so great to stay there cant wait till i can go back.
review.locationRemarks: IT WAS CLOSE TO STORES AND PLACES TO EAT.

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText: It was not the experience I would of want to have. The smell of the room wasn't pleasant. The second night was horrible. I was in the first floor next to the streets. People hanging out there having a good time while you are trying to sleep. Overall it was okay until they charge me twice for the room. Because I booked it online then idk how but they charge me a second time.

review.title: Excellent value,  much nicer than imagined.
review.reviewText: Located in Soma just next to the historic  trolley line linking Castro and the shopping district, this motor hotel is well located and amazingly economical.   A very nice room for 62 dollars and parking for 15 dollars extra.  Nice restaurants around. It isn't a rich area and there are homeless pros about but not in the least threatening.   Will definitely stay here again. Very covenient for gay venues.

review.title: Horrible Customer Service + Charges without Consen
review.reviewText: Terrible!! I wouldn't rate this a 1 at all!! I would so give this hotel a negative -100!! SMH  We booked 3 rooms and during our stay they were some loud as people fighting. Seriously it sounded like if we booked a room in a zoo. Team no sleep.. And not only that they had some rude as people on the Check-in Front desk terrible with bad customer service!! And to top it of our debit cards were super abused multiple times without our consent, if it wasn't for my friend that checked her account we wouldn't of known those extra nonsense fees were charged. And according to the staff it was an error and the money will be given back. As of now we are still waiting to get our money back!! Ohh nooo and let me tell you don't even try asking questions or for help via telephone they sure love clicking on you and having you on hold for almost an hour!!!! Super horrible!!! The staff seriously needs to upgrade with their customer service!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect. But seriously they need to upgrade on their staff..super rude

review.title: Bed bugs!!!
review.reviewText: I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and got bitten by bed bugs (counted 30 bites!). I woke up 3 mornings with the bug on my bed.  There are homeless people wandering in/around the hotel at all hours.  Most of the rooms faces two busy streets and is very noisy.  Perhaps that's why they provide you with ear plugs in the room.  The room door had about an inch opening at the bottom so the street noise traveled even more. Furniture was very old and dirty. I will never stay here again...
review.negativeRemarks: Exterminate for bed bugs!
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants, bars, liquor store, bakery/cafe within walking distance. MUNI station was a couple of blocks away.

review.title: Check your bank account before checking out
review.reviewText: They stole money from our group, we rented 3 rooms and during our stay out cards were swiped for multiple charges, that according to them it was an error and the money will be given back. As of now im still waiting to get my money back and so are my friends! Horriblee. As for the staff!! Disrespectful with no help !!!!!!!!!

review.title: Great value for great price
review.reviewText: Was around 80 a night when we stayed. Room was clean, pretty simple accommodations. Only complaint was the walls were super thin... could hear the neighbors like they were in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Wall insulation
review.locationRemarks: Not a far cab ride from downtown, we didn't do much walking around by the hotel. No parks nearby so we drove to gra

review.title: Convieniently Located
review.reviewText:
Although it was convieniently located, the front desk staff could use an upgrade. My sister had gone downstairs to ask them clear up a misunderstanding about parking and stood there waiting for at least 15 min, along with other guests, while the man was on Facetime or something. She did say it seemed like a potential client, but would it have been so hard to ask them to hold or at least acknowledge the guests in the lobby? However, the woman I checked out with was nice.  
The room was well kept & comfortable. 2 double beds, perfect for me, my sister, & our friend. The continental breakfast is always a plus.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was close to the venue of the concert we were attending AND because it was cheap, relative to other SF hotels. The room we had was very small, with a bed so big that it took up most of the space--there was no room left for a table or dresser or even a decent place to sit. There were people outside (on the street and in the hotel parking lot) making all kinds of noise at all hours of the day and night (the hotel even provided earplugs!). The bed was ok and the room was very clean. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The shower didn't always have hot water. Wi-fi was quirky but worked fine once I figured it out. TV worked fine.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly, room was clean, and the wi-fi worked (although it was a bit quirky).
review.negativeRemarks: Hot water in the shower was unreliable.
review.locationRemarks: Neighborhood is a bit sketchy but not scary. Walking distance to downtown and the Castro District. Bus/BART connections to anywhere.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText:
First the room smell really bad
The bathroom door did not close properly 
The bed wore unstable 
To much car noise from the street
when you give them your credit card for the room deposit they take money out of your account every day so they are stealing money
Parking is almost $20 extra but you can park on the street free at night. They don't tell you that of course. Big restroom only plus.

I just forgot my jacket inside the car and somebody broke my window and stole it I parked in the motel parking and this area there are many homeless people that will look to you and look to your car if you leave anything inside the car they will take it no matter what the thing you leave it in the car. nothing picking this motel was mistake that won't happen again

review.title: Beautiful San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice staff , great place to stay  close to golden gate bridge

review.title: worst money spent
review.reviewText: bad customer service, dirty rooms, noisy and expensive parking per night.
review.negativeRemarks: customer service, room cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: location wasnt in the best area.

review.title: Pathetic hotel. Worst experience
review.reviewText: Had the worst time. Staff is so rude. People knock door late night to disturb u and ask for beer. Cleanliness ok inside the room but outside was pathetic

review.title: Fine hotel for the price. Bad crowd.
review.reviewText:
Stayed there for two nights with my family.

Staff was fine (not particularly nice, but not rude either), room was clean and perfectly fine for the price (just beware parking is $15 extra). Breakfast is ok as long as you're fine with waffles and cereal.

The hotel is not in the middle of everything ,  but it's inside the city and fairly close to everything. 
The neighborhood is fine during the day. At night it's a bit of a different story, there's a bunch of homeless people around, weed smell coming, and  I saw several people drunk and on other stuff... Not really family friendly.

review.title: Staff is rude and snappy!
review.reviewText: RUDE. But they have come a long way.   That is all

review.title: They overcharged my card 505.85
review.reviewText: I was overdrawn because somehow I was way overcharged, although I had paid Expidia!  $505.85

review.title: Felt unsafe
review.reviewText: Did not stay at hotel....felt very unsafe. Receptionist helpful in finding other hotel in area.

review.title: Nice staff and very accommodating.
review.reviewText:
I had booked my stay ,2 day's, separately to get the best rate. They allowed me to stay in the same room .
The lady that checked me in was very efficient and friendly. I think this hotel should have more than a 2 star rating.

review.title: Horrible area!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was horrible, we could barely sleep at night because there was so much noise all night long. Never staying here again!!

review.title: Bedbugs, unauthorized credit card charges
review.reviewText: Room 121, was able to visually see bedbugs. Red spots on my back next morning. $76 unauthorized credit card charge first night, manager said it was a 'glitch', however the second night they went ahead and charged another unauthorized $108 to my card, staff was unable to explain these charges. I had already paid on Expedia AND made a $50 deposit. Have contacted Travelodge Corporate to find out where my missing $190 went.

Went from a king size to a double
Room changed without notice and if you don't like..too bad

review.title: Bad services at a motel in horrible area.
review.reviewText:
I made a booking for Suite of 2 Queen Beds for October 14, 2015 for 2 nights. When I made the reservation, I also request one more roll-away bed since we have 5 adults. However, the front desk gave us a standard room with 2 queen beds. I went to front desk and request roll-away bed. The front desk said there is sofa in the room, one person can sleep on the sofa. I was unhappy about the service and showed the confirmation with my special request for bedding and also pointed out the hotel website also mentioned roll-away bed available on Suite of 2 Queen Beds. Since that, the front desk finally gave us a stowaway bed and we needed to bring the bed to the room at our own. We spent an hour to wait at lobby to get it done. There was only one front desk at that line and about 10 parties waiting in the lobby for check in. 
When we had breakfast in hotel at the morning, there were many non-hotel guests walked in and grabbed some breakfast then left.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer services, of course, and security.
review.locationRemarks: none. horrible location. and so many street people in that area.

review.title: Location and parking
review.reviewText:
Location was very nice
Have to worry about the parking if u come late at night even though u pat $15 extra for parking

review.title: Bait and switch
review.reviewText:
Reserved for king ended up with a double
Not a happy traveler

review.title: Good location but a terrible facility.
review.reviewText:
Good location.

The staff at front desk and housekeeping are good but breakfast servers were rude and dirty.

The hotel has not been updated for over 30 years.

Expedia rated it as a 2 star which it is not - best this is at one star place best a 1 star if it was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Completely renovate the facility

review.reviewText: awful, smelled of smoke was a non smoking room, noisy , transients  , totally bad

review.title: Fairly centralized location
review.reviewText: Right off Market street so easy access to get around town. Quiet area. Although free breakfast was never served.

review.title: Gross room and rude staff!
review.reviewText:
During our 4 night stay we only encountered 1 staff member that was helpful... The rest would fight us on anything we asked for.  We rented the "suite" so that we would have room for a crib (which they didn't have so we had to bring a portable crib ourselves), and had 4 adults and 1 child registered.They consistently only gave us 3 towels and would question us every time we asked for 2 more.  One of the adults came home with bug bites all over her body that we think came from bed bugs! 
The "suite" was slightly bigger than a typical room and was in a dark corner of the hotel.  The room was on the verge of falling apart. The bathroom was tiny and the "closet" area was too small to fit more than 1 piece of luggage in it. We ended up using the couch to keep our luggage off of the floor.  If we had not been in a group, I definitely would not want to be out and about in the part of town where the hotel is located.
We would have changed hotels but there was a conference of some sort going on and we couldn't afford any of the hotels that had vacancy.
We definitely will not be returning to this hotel ever again.
Overpriced and no iron in room.  Location was OK, but did not feel safe.  Premises was dirty. Bar across the street was the best thing.

review.title: Definitely the Worst part of my SanFran Experience
review.reviewText:
*Noisy and Tiny Room
*Bad Area
*Crappy Wifi
*Staff were better than I expected
I wouldn't really recommend unless theres nothing else, Just Being Honest
review.negativeRemarks:
WIFI!!!!
Space in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Not the most ideal location, but there is a Safeway and walgreens fairly close, which was good.

review.title: Not the best hotel I've ever stayed at.
review.reviewText: The front desk clerk was pleasant but the room was utterly dissapointing. It was dark, dank, and dreary. There is no carpeting anywhere in the room, just an ugly tile floor. The beds were lumpy and the furniture was about 10 years out of date. The funniest thing, there were packages of earplugs on the dresser as if to say, "If it gets too noisy for you, plop these in your ears!" Unbelievable!
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need a major overhaul.
review.locationRemarks: The location is about the only thing this hotel has going for it. Situated right on Market Street in the heart of San Francisco is a plus.

review.title: Experience San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff was polite and room was clean but it's hard to ignore the facts. It's a rough area. In 4 nights I heard someone smash a window in the floor below me, woken up at 7am by 2 females high on something looking for a girl named T (they subsequently knocked on several doors). People from the street relieve themselves in the stairs to the 2nd floor and I am pretty sure there were a few shady individuals looking for T too. Very noisy due to traffic and night drama but don't worry room comes with complementary ear plugs. 2 police visits to my floor in 4 days.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor was old but it was clean and kept clean. Cheap. Parking. It's an experience but please don't take kids there or someone you want to impress.
review.negativeRemarks: Improvements will include razing the hotel to the ground and rebuilding it.
review.locationRemarks: 2 minute walk to the F line which gets you to the main Bay Area localities. Easy (uphill walk) to Haights.

review.title: Terrible experience
review.reviewText: My experience was terrible, from check in to check out. Hotel staff is slow to respond to activities going on. There was also a fight on my car, fighting in the parking lot on banging on doors. My drivers license wasn't giving back to me, after calling three times I'm still waiting on them to drop it in the mail
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, especially there front desk staff

review.title: This occasion was terrible.
review.reviewText: I'm on a limited budget because of need for SSDI and frequent need to see physician pursuant to alife saving surgery in May of 2014 and again in this past June.  This is an exception to prior stays in other rooms but this travel lodge  room had a security breach severe enough that  Rx's  we're stolen while I stepped out for a cigarette w/ locked room door in site. Management was responsive but could not  prescribe medication that allowed my doctor to assess me with the benefit of the his care after recent operation.

review.title: Corridors smelt of urine and cigarettes.
review.reviewText: Corridors smelt of urine and cigarettes. Rooms were basic, but clean.  Not a great experience.

review.title: Don't make the same mistake
review.reviewText: If you like to see mouse around you, stay in a very very small room, and meet staff who don't wanna talk to you and just want your money, then go to this hotel.

review.title: Terrible experience
review.reviewText:
The hotel is surrounded by a large community of homeless people who harrassed us in the parking lot. Many of them were hanging out in the different stairwells and 2 cars got broken into during the night. Car alarms kept going off which prevented us from sleeping. 

We cancelled the rest of our stay and moved to another hotel.

review.title: Corner room very small old TV, floor sticky

review.negativeRemarks: Needs complete renovation

review.reviewText: This hotel is an overpriced motel filled with gay couples and motor gangers after all

review.title: Avoid this place if you don't speak Spanish
review.reviewText:
I'd just arrived in the US after a 12-hour flight; "welcome to America" this wasn't!  The receptionist couldn't have been less friendly.  I'd lost my credit card the day before so only had a cash card.  Had to pay with cash - had to go to two ATMs nearby to withdraw cash from the same card that the hotel could have accepted.  Then having paid upfront still had to pay a deposit - with the card that wasn't acceptable to pay the bill with.

The breakfast was awful, and I got told off - in Spanish - for spilling some cereal.  Distinct impression I wasn't welcome as an English speaker.  

Can't say enough to discourage anyone from staying at this awful hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.  A smile would help to start with.
review.locationRemarks: Location OK.

review.title: Would not go back

review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.reviewText: Room was overall clean but we came in like 45 minutes early and the lady at the front desk was a little rude. She pointed out the sign that said check in at 2. Other then that it was all right.

review.title: OK hotel for the price.

review.positiveRemarks: Good location, and parking was affordable.
review.locationRemarks: Easy transportation and restaurants.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Used to be so comfortable, if you're getting this room make sure to get the one on the left side then the second floor. So you won't feel and hear all the passerby walking and the one from the top floor

review.title: Close to city but not a safe area.
review.reviewText:
If you are a light sleeper you'd better skip this place. There were sirens going at all times of the night and very thin walls. The staff were not very helpful or friendly. The breakfast goes until 10:00 exactly, and the staff member locked the door exactly on 10. He also started hurrying us out of the room and announcing how many minutes we had left to eat. The area was unsafe, and there were tons of homeless people on the streets. 
However it is only a few minutes bus ride from downtown and is close to transportation.

review.title: Worst hotel we've stayed in
review.reviewText: When the other reviews said the hotel area is sketchy really believe it, homeless people walking around the area, at night their screaming and arguing outside. The place is more like a motel where hookers live than a hotel for vacationers. Wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. Staff doesn't help in anyway, tried calling them from the room got an answer 30 minutes  later. Walking from motel to union square wouldn't recommend it with children you have to walk by area that are really shady(homeless people, drug dealers etc..). I could continue to write bad stuff but for me and my family we would NEVER go there again. Horrible place to stay while in San Francisco.  Ohh they charge 17 dollars a day for parking and 50 deposit for damage prevention something I've never had to pay when booking other hotels through Expedia.

review.title: Okay for a night
review.reviewText:
The hotel was okay. Checkin took forever. Theres a $17+ parking fee tax included. It looks like they need an updated register. Got a room in 2nd floor with King Bed. As far as location, it's in the middle of bars in SF. I guess that would be an advantage for other people. The next day the lights in our bathroom didn't work. But we didn't get it fixed since we are leaving anyway. But did notify frontdesk about it. Anyway, location is bit noisy but they provide earplugs. :D 

I will stay here again for $80... But if I have to pay more than that, might as well find something else.

Around 1 am both nights we stayed there, it sounded like somebody was moving furniture above us. It was really loud and it went on for about an hour.There was also a lot of yelling outside the room, towards the street side. Obviously this isn't the hotel's fault, they left us foam ear plugs on the table in the room, so I'm sure I'm not the first person to "complain" about this. San Fran is an expensive city and you get what you pay for.

review.title: Worst hotel I've ever seen!!!
review.reviewText: STAY AWAY FROM THIS MOTEL NOT A HOTEL!!!  In a few words this place is horrible, dirty, crack heads hanging out in the lobby, dirty, dirty and DIRTY!

review.title: Affordable accomadations

review.locationRemarks: Trolley close, take to fishermans wharf

review.title: Convenient location, poor facilities.

review.title: Worse rver

Charging me $15 a day for parking while there is no option to park on the street . 

The bads are not comfortable at all . 

I'm not recommending this place , also it's not even cheap motel .
Hotel location not great, staff overworked or not efficient at checkin

review.title: Kind of a dump.
review.reviewText:
This was an emergency stay as I live near by.  Needs refurbishing, gap at bottom of door, TV is old and picture is blurry, bathroom is rudimentary.  Bed was comfortable.
Would not stay here again but it was cheap for one night emergency....

review.title: Sleepless Noisy Nights
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel for the price and the location, soon we learned that it was near a homeless camp and they constantly hung out in the parking lot by the dumpster constantly looking for leftover food scraps, if this wasn't annoying enough the initial room we were assigned had a 30 year old king bed that had seen better days. It was so badly sagging that my wife requested we be given another room, and it was only slightly better but the manager said they all are over 30 years. The nights were almost impossible to bear, the building must not have any insulation in the walls or ceiling, the TV, voices and chatter, arguments could be clearly heard at all hours of the day and night, you know you are in the worst conditions when they leave complementary ear plugs on the night stand. We had nights that were torturous, the noise was endless. The rooms are old and dingy, no carpet, out of date, we were completely disappointed with our decision to say in this hotel, it was based on the price and what we believed to be acceptable location. We would never recommend this hotel, we learned a valuable lesson that a two star hotel is going to be a poor choice, make your choice wisely, investigate toughly or you could be in for a very unpleasant experience as we have learned. Yes this is a Travelodge, but it is way past its prime and we would strongly recommend seeking another choice.
review.positiveRemarks: The only redeeming quality is that it is located near the business district, other than that, nothing!!
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel is long overdue for a complete makeover, sound proof the walls and ceiling.
review.locationRemarks: The only redeeming quality is that it is located near the business district, plenty of restaurants and businesses near by.

review.title: Horrible

review.title: worst experience ever

review.title: Nightmare!

review.title: Alright motel for the price!

review.title: Great location, cheap room

review.positiveRemarks: Location, access to transportation, great rates.

review.title: Nasty hotel with nasty management.
review.reviewText: Don't expect a good experience, and don't expect the manager to care one bit about your crappy experience. I for one will never stay at any travelodge in the future. I've stayed at nasty roach motels that felt like a better deal for my money!
Hotel a little run down and in need of refurbishment, wifi not very good, showers luke warm. Also in a undesirable area but is close to tram lines which was good.

All we wanted to do was check in and rest. We were also checked into a Smoking room after we had reserved a NON-Smoking room...nevertheless, this was fixed right away after two gentlemen agreed to exchange their NON-Smoking room for ours.

There were four pillows on the king bed but they were too underfilled. I paid about $60 a night plus $15 for parking which compared to anything else in the area seemed like a good deal.

Location is great and easy access to public transportation and great restaurants all walking short distances

review.positiveRemarks: price and location close to muni stop

review.title: Fair hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Outside was noisy. I knew we were to have problems when I saw the ear plugs on the night stand. Thoughtful, but the first time I have ever seen them at a hotel. All floors were tiled, so take slippers. Had a refer and micro which was nice even though we didn't use them. Staff was very helpful and tried to solve problem.
review.positiveRemarks: This was an average hotel.  It is what it is, a cheap hotel in San Francisco. A very good breakfast and close to all transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet was almost nonexistent. Computer said we were connected, but it wouldn't come up. Better cable television.
review.locationRemarks: Trolleys, busses and taxis are all within a few paces.  The wharf and downtown are a few miles straight down the road. Easy access to everything.

review.title: Crumby, falling apart & surrounded by the homeless
review.reviewText: Payed for a room with a sofa, safe & other extras & was given a room the sz of a postage stamp w/only 2 beds. Had to argue & show the website picture on my phone to get a bigger room which still didn't have what I paid for. Horrible area w/parking lot full of homeless since they allow them to eat the breakfast that's for the guests. My room looked like it had been patched in every corner. The bedspread in my non smoking room had cig burn holes. Noises all through the night. TOTAL NIGHTMARE! Don't stay here!

review.title: Noisy, rude, uncomfortable.
review.reviewText: This location is noisy all hours of the night,  and not just because it's the middle of the city. The walls are paper thin and people were screaming,  yelling,  banging on doors and walls. The room itself is ok, but the beds were horribly uncomfortable. We reserved and paid for a king and ended up with two "deluxe" beds. When we caked the front desk to schedule a wake up call, no one answered. When we finally got someone, they said they would schedule one, but never did. Knowing what I know now, I would've gotten better sleep in my car in a parking garage.

review.title: Scruffy motel in run down area
review.reviewText: We had booked the hotel on line for 2 nights not knowing that hotels in SF were overloaded with convention participants. Consequently we paid $260 per night due to "dynamic pricing". The rooms were very small. To get from the door to the bathroom required walking crab like between the end of the bed and the wall. It was not clean. The day after we left the room rate had reduced to $90 still overpriced  for the accommodation provided.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner room. Knocking some walls down to provide a liveable space to spend a night.
review.locationRemarks: If one is a tourist there is nothing closeby to see.

review.title: just not worth it for the price
review.reviewText: the worst hotel ive ever been stayed at! too much noise and people using drugs!

review.title: on market street
review.reviewText: many bars within walking distance, walgreens and credit union close by, parking was 15+tax, room was ok, beds we're done, small bathroom, it was busy at check in so the older gentleman did not greet anyone

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: All I have to say is, if you don't mind homeless people trying to get into your room in the middle of the night and being in constant fear of your car being broken into, then stay here. The man at the front desk was perfectly nice, but this place was absolutely terrible. Spend an extra $20 a night and stay somewhere nicer.

review.title: Good enough to stay close to the city center
review.reviewText: Good to spend night, clean bathroom and shower, tv cable and fridge. Linen in good shape. No carpeted room unfortunately.

review.title: The hotel is dirty and the rooms are unconfortable
review.reviewText: Was a bad experience, the bed was queen, no king how said to me by phone, the room smelled really bad
review.locationRemarks: the location is good

review.title: Room without carpet
review.reviewText: I wish the room can be carpeted. Tiles are okay, but as a Muslim, I'd prefer the floor to be covered with carpet, because that would be more comfortable for me to perform prayers. Everything else is nice and okay.

review.title: Great, urban location; Poorly maintained property.
review.reviewText: This motel is at the intersection of The Castro, The Mission, SOMA, Hayes Valley and the mid-Market corridor, and has a PARKING LOT which is virtually unheard-of in San Francisco. Having stayed in SF hotels & motels for years, this is by far my favorite location though this property is in dire DIRE need of a complete remodel. It's very old, outdated, and nearly every part of the property (and every item in the room) is beyond the end of its useful life. Everything works but everything (and I mean every item) needs to be thrown away and replaced. That said, the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, and the rate I was charged seemed very reasonable to me for what I got. I feel like I got what I paid for.
This is a modest old motel, not a hotel really, all is nice, just could be a bit cheaper for this level of comfort (although I don't know much about hotel's market in SF)
review.locationRemarks: 10 mins by bus/tram to Union Sq.

review.title: Not for single women
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little scary for single women.  It's a MOTEL, not a hotel.  Guests are noisy, so the motel provides earplugs.  Yes, that bad.  Out of 4 mornings, I had hot water only twice; the other showers were lukewarm.  The rooms are very very basic.  But it is very convenient -- on a direct trolley line to downtown, convention center, etc.  And there are 2 excellent restaurants nearby -- especially a Brazilian steakhouse to which I will definitely return.  I would not have stayed here if a male colleague didn't also have a room here and travel back and forth with me in the morning and at night.  The office is only open days; you have to use a walkup window after 8pm to ge tyour key and I hated that.  If the clerk didn't feel safe, how could I feel safe?
review.negativeRemarks: needs reliable hot water, needs a renovation, needs lighting outside to make it safer.  Lobby needs to be open later at nigand earlier in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Estepa (sp?) is a Brazilian steakhouse nearby that is just fantastic.  really really good.

review.title: Don't have high expectations
review.reviewText: I was really worried about the hotel, so my expectations were really low. If you just need a bed, a TV and a bathroom - this place works. You do need the earplugs they provide,on the nightstand next to the bed, because of the traffic noise outside.

review.title: so terrible!
review.reviewText:
Bed bugs and lots of crawling small insects.
Picked up a phone to call the front desk coz of the poor internet connection just to drop it right away coz there's a small insect in the mouthpiece
We checked out in the middle of the next night. No point of staying here coz we can't sleep of the nightmare

review.title: Worst hotel
review.reviewText: Located in one of the worst areas of San Francisco, noisy, loud guests that are usually locals!! When the front desk is called about the noise, you get a visit from a member of the SFPD SWAT team. It is virtually impossible to get a full nights sleep!!!

review.title: Hidden fees, not very satisfying
review.reviewText: Couldnt find me in the computer for my reservation. Gave me a non smoking room with 2 small beds when I made the reservation I asked for 1 big bed & a smoking room! Charged me 17.50 a night for parking. Wasn't very nice room.

review.title: Worse place to stay if want peace and quite.
review.reviewText: The parking lot was very loud and fights going on.  If not out by check out time, they'll kick it.

review.title: Stay elsewhere!
review.reviewText: when confirming reservation I was hung up on 8 Times called 20 times total..was told sry we are busy ...click...really!....booked room with one king size bed ..my daughter and I had to share a double size bed in a corner room half the size of there other rooms..they offered nothing and no discount for the inconvenience ...I parked in handicap space as I have disabilities and have permitted parking plaque..at check out they tried to charge me $17.00 For parking at the hotel I paid to stay at ? I did not pay after showing them paperwork from dmv that states they are not allowed to charge me for parking.....the only way they can charge for parking is if they had a pay for use parking garage.....so not happy window lock in room was broken had to put coat hanger in window to secure it...bed was sqeaky and wore out ...but the staff there is beyond rude and unacceptable ...never again ...our room e en had garbage in the trash can when we walked in ...staff did not even care
review.negativeRemarks: staff was horrible ...did not get what we paid for
review.locationRemarks: markwt st sf very close to ucsf hospital

review.title: Not that central, noisy, tired décor
review.reviewText:
It's very cheap for a city hotel, but unless price is your only criteria I suggest money is better spent somewhere else. It's a looong walk from the tourist areas, so if you have a car you might as well stay further away assuming better value for money.
We stayed on Halloween night and lots were going on. Car's in the yard with booming bass, guests (who seemed to be permanent residents) smoking/chatting outside our door and other noises. We didn't feel safe or secure. 
The room was really small, the décor and furniture was tired - e.g. rips in the bed covers.  I think it was clean, but it was difficult to tell. Our toilet didn't flush, so we decided to leave rather than change room.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoking should be banned.  Hallway/stairs should not be a meeting point for guests/residents
review.locationRemarks: It's a long walk to town

review.title: Do not stay here if you're visiting
review.reviewText: This was the dirtiest hotel ever. Staff was very slow, out of date computer system,  bad neighborhood.

review.title: Horrible Front Desk
review.reviewText: I reserved a king bed room. After I got into an argument with the front desk clerk over having to get cash for the deposit when I had a credit card. he was extremely rude and told me he cancel my reservation. He finally gave me my room key and when I opened the door the room was the size of a shoebox and the bed was a full not a king. I went to complain and ask for what I paid for. He yelled at me and then he told me he could do a double bed room for 10 more. I will never stay here again. Very rude.
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: Hell/Dungeon/Nightmare/Management isn't Competent
review.reviewText:
I stayed 3 Days in this Hotel. I visited more than 85 Countries and this is the
worst Hotel i ever stayed.

Walls are like paper you here everything from your Neighbors. The bed are not comfortable and
the flour was dirty at the check in. The Price for the parking is to much and the breakfast is
a shame --- Bread and Coffee....

I forgot my Cell phone in my room and the whole staff was not able to organize a call. The Management Nina, i tried to call her 80 times, was not able to call me back even one more time.

I think they don't know what kind business they do ! Stay away from this place...

Is the Dungeon/Nightmare of San Francisco...

review.title: Noisy Hotel
review.reviewText: Asked for a non-smoking room, room smelled of smoke as soon as I walked in.. My clothes smelt of smoke when I left. Was very noisy all the way up till 3 am.. Then noisy again at 7:30am.. Hardly any parking available on the property ($15).
I had a great stay. Most thing I liked that it was affordable and close to everything I wasp red to go too. Great breakfast in the morning and overall I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Rude
review.reviewText: stole money and had rude service very bad business.

review.title: Perfect for what we needed...........
review.reviewText: We needed a room close to city hall for the San Francisco Giants celebration parade. This hotel was only about 2 blocks away. We paid $15 for parking there, so it was convenient for us to just walk there. The area was a bit noisy, but not too much of an issue if your only staying 1 night. I would say, however, if your going there on a week long trip with or without kids, this isn't the place I would recommend. But that's just my opinion. Overall I am happy with our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Something to reduce the noise from outside instead of the ear plugs that were on the night stands. LOL. And i'm not kidding about the ear plugs.
review.locationRemarks: baseball stadium was close, piers were close, but not really walking distance, and nice little restaurants in the area.

review.title: If you're desperate
review.reviewText:
You get what you pay for: we only picked it because there was nothing else available. It's really noisy at night with all sorts of nefarious goings on in the car park and rooms. Keep your doors and windows locked at all times as there is no security and anyone can get into the complex at any time. Someone tried to break into our room one night while we were in bed. The police were called to a fight in the car park the next day. Staff were on the whole unfriendly or uncaring and in one case downright rude.

It's 10-15 min walk to the Muni and apart from one cafe there isn't anything nearby. You'll have to get transport to anything and it'd a bit of a walk through a seedy part of San Francisco. 

Avoid.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Nice place to stay and cheap
review.reviewText: Directly across the road from the F tram into the city and into the castro district. Price was great and amenities what you would expect from a hotel. Not bad at all. I would stay there again.

review.title: Over priced for what  you get
review.reviewText: Bed OK, noisy due to flimsy windows, really needs updating, was OK clean, but not a place to stay again for this much money

review.title: Great Location. 1.5 mi walk from everything
review.reviewText:
Great location especially when the rest of the hotels are expensive.
1.5 mi to Powell BART and minutes walk to the Mission District!
It was OK. Not worth $600 for two nights. Checking in took forever.

review.title: Bad part of town
review.reviewText: I had never heard of "the Tenderloin" district prior to my stay at this Travelodge. Now I know I will never stay in or near this neighborhood ever again.

review.title: Simple, very convenient, well located

It is a quite simple and honest hotel. It has access to great bus lines and access to the main connections to the city.
Service was great, great people. Not for people looking for a place to rest, but to have access to the city.
review.negativeRemarks: It is quite old, room could be renovated, but ok.
review.locationRemarks: good restaurants around, bus lines on the corner of the street.

review.title: Earplugs on dresser--indicator of noisy place.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: This hotel was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. We paid $300 for one night. It's was dirty and the beds were horrible. I wouldn't stay there again even if the rooms were free.

review.title: Clean and Safe
review.reviewText: Close to everything, came back for a second stay a year later.

review.title: OK hotel but got 7-8 bug bites

review.title: Great Location, Great Price, OK room

I did have to pay extra upon arrival for parking. Very average all around. I would stay again just for the location and price.
its a nice cheap place to stay close to good places to eat and transportation.

review.title: Friendly hotel staff, but terrible accommodations
review.reviewText:
I have never stay in a hotel that cannot control its guest.  I had the most disrespectful neighbors --- loud, drunk, under the influence of something, fighting, crying, screaming until 3:00 am. 

I contacted the front desk several times, and they never followed up.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Its a small convenient hotel that is clean and was economical and provided breakfast

review.title: Adequate accommodations, good b-fast!
review.reviewText: Breakfast was a pleasant surprise! Loved it!  However, hard to get sleep at night.  VERY noisy! You could hear everyone passing by the room ...and their conversations.  Parking was a HUGE issue as well.  You pay to park in the hotel lot, but their is NO guarantee you will be able to ever park there, especially if you leave for dinner or to sight see in the evening. There is no additional, available parking anywhere close. Lack of parking price is fairly substantial compared to condition of facilities ....something to consider when you are booking a hotel in a city you are not familiar with.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was a lovely surprise.  Great way to start the day!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking needs to be improved as well as decorator touches.  Floor was linoleum in room. Cold to the feet.  Bedspread and bed very uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Location was okay, fairly close to freeway and easy to get to various site seeing places.  Not much to do at night, and advisable to not walk alone.

review.title: Good Location and Value
review.reviewText: Its located walking distance between The Castro area and Downtown with a trolley right in front that will take you up and down Market street and to the Warf . Its not far from Civic center either. It is not fancy but nice for the price. It was clean and comfortable. The free little morning breakfast was a nice touch coffee, Juice, waffles, toast, cereal, Etc.  It can be a little noisy because each door opens to the outside and in the morning when the cleaning staff is doing there thing but the staff I encountered were helpful. Its nice to have a coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave in the room. If you are looking for a basic nice place to stay. This is it.
review.positiveRemarks: walking distance between The Castro area and Downtown with a trolley right in front. coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave in room free breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Morning cleaning and maintenance  staff could be a little quieter
review.locationRemarks: Its walking distance between The Castro area and Downtown with a trolley right in front that will take you up and down Market street and to the Warf

review.title: If you cannot find room anywhere else

review.title: Downtown

we had five people and if we wanted a cot we would receive it our second night

review.title: LOCATION GOOD

review.title: Noises. We can't sleep.

The room is connected to another room by a wood door. Can hear the strangers clearly and need to worry about if they would come over.

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: It works. Its clean, roomy and has what you need. Nothing special but good enough to bring your girlfriend.

review.title: Hotel nice location, close to shops
review.reviewText: We liked the location because we were able to walk to several stores and China town. We don't recommend the stay for a long period of time in hotel, but convenient to spend a day exploring San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location, easy access to several spots that my family and I enjoyed visiting.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast should include more variety due to the price.
review.locationRemarks: China town was waking distance, as well as other shops.

review.title: Disappointing from start to finish
review.reviewText:
The location was convenient, because it was near public transportation and the freeway. Parking was expensive, and charged per day. Despite buying parking, it seemed like there weren't enough spots to accommodate all guests. 
The room was extremely small, with only 2 full size beds for 4 people, and very little space to do anything else. When we arrived, there was no shower curtain, no bath mat, and only 3 towels, despite registering 4 people to the room. We called the front office so we could get a shower curtain, and when the housekeeper arrived with the shower curtain, we also asked if we could have another towel, and more blankets. She walked out of the room and very audibly began trash talking us in Spanish to her colleague, assuming we didn't know what she was saying. We ended up only receiving one blanket, and nothing else that we requested. On our last night, we still only received 3 towels and once again needed to ask for more.
The "breakfast" was very meager, even for a continental breakfast.
The internet was either incredibly slow, or did not work at all.
In the past, we have been happily surprised by Expedia's "Unpublished Rate Hotels," but this time we were overwhelmingly disappointed. We will not be returning.

review.title: Bad hotel in seedy area
review.reviewText:
Sticky floors
Non smoking room stank of smoke
Mold in bathroom
Green water on the window sill
Noisy at 6:30 am with people beeping horns in the car park.
Breakfast was ok oats or toast.

review.title: Good value for the price.

review.title: Disapointed in San Francisco

review.negativeRemarks: complete renovation

review.title: BASIC BUT ACCEPTABLE.

SMALL ROOMS,  BREAKFAST SIMPLE BUT OK.
BASIC AFORDABLE STAY.
review.negativeRemarks: CLEANING

review.title: Clean the Rooms!
review.reviewText:
Upon check-in, I found a shortage of towels and, in general, dirty conditions. There was garbage under one of the beds (including drug paraphernalia) and the bathroom was grungy.

Also, this was supposed to be a non-smoking room, yet it reeked of cigarette odor.

Finally, my reservation was for a deluxe King room, yet I was given a decidedly sub-standard queen (2 beds) room.
review.negativeRemarks: Much better cleaning of rooms by housekeeping staff.

review.title: War zone!
review.reviewText: I'm pretty easy going when it comes to hotels but this is the worst place I've ever stayed in my life. Tile floors, the room stunk like some kind of chemicals, bad AC, got a piece of glass in my foot, dirty, dirty, dirty. Druggys and bums everywhere. Expedia should drop this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: War zone!

review.title: Very central. Tram stop just out front
review.reviewText: Overall this place is OK. Rooms clean, and easy access to all transport. Easy drive from airport, must have GPS. However be extremely careful using your credit card here. There is a scam operating out of the motel, they ring your room, and say it is front desk, and that their computers have crashed and need to update their system. They call you by name, then ask for your card details again, we did this and then checked with the front desk in person, they did not call our room. We had to cancel our card. They take$20 off your card, not just an imprint, we were prepaid. This is how they get access to your card. It was our first day in America and really made our holiday horrible.
review.negativeRemarks: The front office staff are not to be trusted
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.title: dreadfully noisy hotel, too far down Market Street

review.reviewText: online booking is much cheaper than booking in person

Internet timed out after a very short time preventing downloads.

review.title: Desk Clerk was extremely rude.

It took about 3 hours to check in with a pre-paid reservation. During those 3 hours, I had to call Expedia and Travelodge and loudly complain over their refusal to accept my mother as a guest.
Admittedly, the desk clerk did nothing to assist in telling us the information we needed and getting the right information and that is why it took so long. Travelodge never responded to my complaints nor did they apologize for the desk clerk's rudeness.

review.title: Good location but I was overcharged in my room.

The neighbourhood where this hotel is looks dodgy and isn't very safe in the night. It is good if you have your own car to move around.

review.title: Very clean and quite

review.title: This is the worse place I have stay at in 20yrs.

review.title: Ok stay nothing over the top
review.reviewText: It was ok nothing great just ok I would stay here again just for a one night stay but long term anything over a day or night would not be ok.

review.title: Nice hotel with excellent staff. No complaints.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Travel Lodge. The hotel staff were excellent. They got me a shuttle to the airport when I needed one, helped me find a stamp at one point, and provided me with local information about where to eat and what to do. The room, itself, was alright. It was functional and comfortable enough and the rates were low. The walls were a bit thin so noise crept in from outside (this was mostly a problem on Saturday night when I had to fly out early on Sunday) but what can you do? Overall, I would recommend this place.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent hotel staff, great location, comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from other rooms / outside.

review.title: Great price and right next to everything.
review.reviewText: The hotel was surprisingly nice considering how much I paid.The staff there were really efficient and every time I left, I came back to a really clean Room. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. I would definitely stay at the Travelodge again.

review.title: Disappointing is a good word.
review.reviewText: Expected a lot more from Travelodge from what they charged for a room. The hotels near and around this street did not look nearly as nice as the ones closer to the wharf. If you're deciding between hotels and a tourist, try to get one of the ones closer to the bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Short walk (~0.5mi) to Muni and Bart.
review.negativeRemarks: Door locks were a bit lacking....
review.locationRemarks: Homeless people everywhere, but that's SF. Location not very family friendly.

review.title: Worst Place I've Ever Stayed!!!
review.reviewText: I'm shocked that Expedia promotes this pig stye and that Travelodge owns it! The floor was sticky, the room filthy and the building and neighborhood loud. Changed rooms, but was not much better. Cigarette burns in all of the linens in my non-smoking room.Would have changed hotels if I hadn't been so exhausted. The staff was apathetic. All I needed was a clean room for the night. Didn't get that. Still tired. Tried to sleep on top of the bed. Left early to get out of that horrid situation.Better to sit in a lobby for 3 hours waiting for my meeting than spend another minute a that Travelodge!
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING!!!
review.locationRemarks: FIND ANOTHER PLACE TO STAY IN BEAUTIFUL SAN FRANCISCO

review.title: Cheap motel

review.positiveRemarks: It was nice to have the microwave, minifridge, and breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: It was not a very nice part of town. I didn't feel very safe.
