review.title: Never staying at the hotel again!
review.reviewText: We reserved a non-smoking room. Unfortunately smoking outside of the room and downstairs doesn't apply to the non-smoking request. I was unable to sleep all night due to the smoke and started to have breathing problems. We were suppose to stay here for 2 days, I checked us out first thing in the morning and had to find another place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: decor in the room was decent, that was about it. Location was not in a good area, parking was bad and service was also bad
review.negativeRemarks: better security, remove people off premises that are just hanging out
review.locationRemarks: NA

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText:
Walls were paperthin noise noise and more noise

Will not stay there again
Not in the greatest part of town. Pretty noisy. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and accommodating

review.title: Conveient Location to the Mission District at S. F
review.reviewText: We spend 8 days in San Francisco to visit the family during the holidays. The location is convenient to the Mission District, a 15 minute walk to dolores Park and many restaurants on Market, Valencia, and Mission Street. The room is very clean. The breakfast is adequate. However, the Wi-Fi and the room key never worked during my entire stay. Every night we had to make our way back to the front desk to rekey to get into our room. The staf was not helpful or eager to correct the inconvenience about the problem we encounter. There were several nights during our stay there, the people stayed above us was noisey and party and carry on with their conversation accross the building till 3 o'clock in the morning. When we issued our concern at the front desk, the staff looked as and said "It always gets noise during the holidays. It is the same evrywhere" I guess, this means-- Business as usual. Of course, we can not expect a more considerble guess to stay at Travelodge. But for the price we pay to stay at Travelodge, $130 a night , I do expect a more friendly, helpful staff to solve the problems we encountered.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient for my visit to the family live in Mission District
review.negativeRemarks: Front Desk Staff should be more more friendly, helpful to resolve the room keys, and Wi-Fi problem.
review.locationRemarks: Mission Church, Dolores Park, numourous restaurants are walking distance 15, 20 min. a great antique shop called "Stuff" is right across on Valencia.

review.reviewText: very noise. seems like people who stay there don't sleep. you can hear people talking and music all night long.

review.title: Crack den near the Civic Center
review.reviewText:
Me and my boyfriend stayed her on NYE so we could be close to the venue for Sea Of Dreams, the Civic Center. Let's just say I'm glad the time we were in the room was minimal. The parking was ridiculous, he had people paking in handicapped spaces and spaces that weren't even for parking because he wasn't able to accomodate the crowd. He was rude, and took forever checking people in. The room was less than satisfactory for the price and the checkout was insanely early for after NYE, and when we accidentally overslept by a little bit, they were incredibly rude and aggressive, threatening to charge us for another night.

Cheapest place available for NYE by the time I booked the room, but definitely not worth the money. I would have rathered pay like $50 more and not stayed in a crack den with crazy people yelling outside at all hours of the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: It's within walking distance to the Civic Center

review.reviewText: My wife lost pair of undies during our stat while we're out. But nice people, clean room.

review.title: Cheap hotel that shows in quality
review.reviewText: I wanted to see the city and so decided to get a hotel. I looked online and the price was right (as opposed to over $200 at other places), so I booked it. Let me tell you, you get what you pay for. The room was the size of a closet. The bed fit in the room, but barely. On the website, it claimed to be a king bed but I would be surprised if it were even a full. That was basically the only thing in the room. I should say that the room appeared to be clean (appeared being the key word). It is right near the street though so you can hear people and cars going at all times of the night. If you are looking for a place to lay your head at the cheapest price around, this would be your place. If you are looking for even a little more, move on and find something better.

review.title: Good staffing hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel location is very good. Public transport just a step away from hotel. No need to change transport to go to the famous fisherman wharf. Parking have to pay. Room was small and the air conditioner (heater) was so noisy. The free wifi was so terrible,Its practically useless.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wifi
review.locationRemarks: Easily accesible by public transport

review.reviewText: Good value for the money;
review.negativeRemarks: sparce breakfast selection

review.title: Nice hotel but noisy neighbourhood
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, well maintained at a decent price. Good customer service. No complaints about the hotel itself. Very sketchy and loud neighbourhood. Not the hotel's fault where it's located.

review.title: Worst. WiFi. Ever.
review.reviewText:
1) The WiFi at this hotel is so slow it will remind you of the days of dial-up modems! We both had work to get done but gave up and had to use our phone for some of it and went to a cafe to get on our laptops.
2) When one of us lost his key the front desk gave us a new one WITHOUT asking for our NAME or asking to see IDENTIFICATION. So anyone could have asked for a key to our room. Made me feel really secure!
3) Bring earplugs if you want to get sleep, because the sketchy intoxicated people who frequent the hotel tend to scream and yell at all hours of the night.
review.positiveRemarks: It has a parking lot. It's inexpensive. It's in a good central location for walking access to multiple neighborhoods (Castro, Missions, Civic Center)
review.negativeRemarks: They really need to improve the WiFi. They need to train their staff better on security.

review.title: Always loud.
review.reviewText: Would have been an ejoyable and recommendable experience if there hadn't been constant banging and no insulation. But for the price $75 (PLUS . $17.50/day for PARKING) find a better spot. Would be better priced at $55 flat.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Banging and clattering from overhead room. Halls noisy. Took 45 minutes to check in because only one staff member to answer phone and take care of customers on a busy Friday evening. Very inappropriate language and gestures in the lobby, which made us very uncomfortable while having our teenage daughters with us.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in. Noise level.

review.title: Nice hotel for a good price
review.reviewText: It was nice at a reasonable price. But the appliances didn't work as well as i wish; the room facilities were a lil bit worn out and i wish i'd seen some eggs at the breakfast. Overall it was ok.

review.title: Nothing like the pictures
review.reviewText: I was so excited to find a hotel that was affordable and within walking distance of the race that I was in town for. To my dismay, the staff was less than helpful, they charge $20 a night on top of your room fee for parking (in a lot where they allow people to double and triple park, making it impossible to move your car in the morning), the rooms are very small and the bathroom will leave you feeling less than clean after your shower. My room was one with a king size bed, which was surprisingly alright, however it took up almost all of the floor space in my room. The bathroom door did not even latch, making it super awkward to even take a shower when my sister (who was staying with me) was there. The hotel staff did not keep an eye on the hotel, as there were homeless people sleeping on the staircases to get to the parking lot. The really frustrating part was that even after I checked out at 6 am (my race started at 630) they charged me $10 more for an extra fee. So thank you to this hotel for a bad night sleep, $20 to be blocked into a parking lot (thank goodness I have a small car), and a random $10 fee for nothing. You won't be getting any business from my friends, family, or me.

review.title: Old building well cleaned.
review.reviewText: Very clean inspite of it being an old building. Mildew on the ceiling and big gaps under the doors. Area loud at night. Parking was tight. Good location to see San Fransisco. If you can get a good rate it's OK.

review.title: Hotel itself was fine. The area was Bad.
review.reviewText: Lots of crack addicts all around. Scarey at times!!!

review.title: If you're looking for a nice location, ok
review.reviewText: We went through Expedia to book our room. We specifically booked a non-smoking room with a King Sized bed. When we arrived at the hotel, the attendant gave us a non-smoking room with two double beds. I went back to attendant to explain the mistake, and he said he did not have any non smoking/King sized bed rooms available. After much discussion, he "found" a King sized bed...in a smoking room. Choosing the best of two bad options, we selected the smoking room. Even as non-smokers, the smokey room was not entirely unpleasant. But this was: my wife discovered a small roach crawling up a wall in the bath room. Conclusion: if you're in a pinch, this hotel would be OK. Hotels in San Francisco can be very expensive. But if you are celebrating a special occasion, this is not where you'll want to spend it. Finally, there are no good restaurants in walking distance: you'll need to drive, which means navigating through crazy traffic, or take a cab, which will require you to have taken out a second mortgage to pay for.

Checkout time was 11am, I woke up early at 6:30am to leave as soon as possible. I have stayed in many hotel/motel rooms, this is by far the worst I have ever been in or have ever of. Walk in rate was $289, expedia rate was $149, both a factor of 10X more than the value they delivered.

review.title: Too Much Drama and Noise.
review.reviewText: I picked the location because it is central to great restaurants and shopping. Seems to be an older hotel with nicely updated rooms and baths, but with little/no insulation between walls and thin windows. The tile floors didn't reduce the noise factor either. We were awakened both nights with fighting and shouting from the parking lot and from the rooms around us. Not a safe or relaxing feeling. When the polite staff asked each day if I was enjoying my stay, I mentioned my frustration with the noise. They seemed to think it was part of the character of the City on a weekend. I wouldn't suggest staying there with kids or elderly. I marked the Expedia box that required parking in my search and thought it was included in the quoted price per night. The hotel added $15.00 per night extra. I wish it were clearer. Next time I'll pay a few dollars extra for a more relaxing experience.

review.title: No Hot Water
review.reviewText: Hotel was pleasing and the complimentary breakfast was well stocked. However, when we got up there was no hot water after three people in my party showered. I went to the front desk and explained the situation. The gentleman at the front desk said he was aware of the problem because other guest had complained. He said he would take care of it and it should take about 15 minutes. After 20 minutes there was still no hot water so I again went to the front desk and he said he would have to call a plumber and it would take another 15 minutes. I explained that we really needed to get on the road and if our last guest could just use one of the empty rooms to just take a shower so we could go. He said we could not do that and the hot water should be on soon. After almost an hour we finally go hot water. When I went to check out the gentleman just apologized for the inconvenience. I felt he should have gave me credit for the parking since we had to wait an hour. He could have easily let us use one of the empty rooms but it seemed he did not know how to handle the problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff not knowing how to deal with a difficult situation.

I booked a non smokers room but when I checked in and got to my room it had two ash treys and reeked of old cigarettes; there were cigarette burns every where, on the tv, in the bathroom and even on the blankets!!! The only positive thing I can say about this place is that it was located in the perfect spot for my trip to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance for where I needed and wanted to go.

review.title: Budget hotel (more motel)!
review.reviewText: Defiantly a motel. Located just a bit to far out of town for us. We had a weeks pass which was $28 & enabled you to travel all day every day on the trams (a must for San Francisco (and each journey on these is €6)), Street cars and buses. I would recommend the Airport shuttle if arriving in darkness as it can be a little nervous trying to locate and you do have to change to either the metro or street cars. The hotel itself is just a bit out of town for us. Only one Martini bar near which is not great if u enjoy a beer. Best area is around Union Square for bars and food eateries. We booked a non-smoking room and did have to move straight away because our first room stank of stale cigarettes but they did do this no problems. Room cleanliness was good. Fresh towels and toiletries every day. There are millions of street people living in San Francisco and all night long you can hear them going through the hotel bins. As one leaves the another would arrive to continue the same routine and you can hear the clicking of the bottles, cans and rubbish being constantly sieved through all night long! As there are so many street people it does make the streets a little nervous in the afternoon/evenings and I would recommend public transport for own piece of mind when returning back to the hotel. We asked the hotel to book a taxi for us for an early start but never arrived! Breakfast was sufficient. You can't really fault the hotel for the price paid.
review.positiveRemarks: The price and breakfast was included.
review.negativeRemarks: The street people relentlessly going through the bins all night which you could constantly hear from your rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Just a bit out of central area for bars and restaurants.

review.title: Close to Mission and Castro
review.reviewText:
The airport shuttle was not free, as I had assumed, which was a part of the reason we stayed there. Fortunately, the BART starts service early a.m. and is walking distance with reasonable amounts of baggage (6 blocks or so). We did not have reasonable amounts of baggage, but managed.

The hotel is close to downtown, the Mission, Castro, which is fun for going out late and good food. East Bay easily accessible from the BART station. Many people sleeping on the streets around there, but is a short walking distance to other kinds of neighborhoods.

Huge king sized bed, could have slept four. The room is a little small for the size of the bed, but if you don't need a lot of extra floor space, that can work.

Breakfast was normal, with cold cereals, juice, packaged pastries, fruit, bread, toaster, and coffee. The coffee was not my favorite, but there was a machine in the room (bring your own filter if you want to brew coffee you bring along).

All in all, worked for us.

review.title: Think twice, but it won't be horrible
review.reviewText:
I would like to rate this Hotel with a higher raking.
We booked online and in all fairness I know if you read the fine print it does not guarantee the bed you requested. We wanted one king and received two doubles.
The noise during the night was very disturbing. Granted you are staying in a large city, but because of the location close to the highway most of the night was full on sirens and people trying to get into their rooms after perhaps having some arguments with their partners inside.
Also we arrived at 7 p.m, the interior office was already closed and had to wait in line outside to check in. They were so understaffed one man was doing everything. When I questioned him about the bed he was a bit unraveled but did compose himself quickly.
Who knows how his night had been. The beds are hard, which normally doesn't bother me but when I can't sleep because of the noise it might had helped for some more comfort.
All this said, if a friend asked me about the hotel, I would give all the downfalls but let them know the location is good.

review.title: It's AWFUL. Slightly scary and unpleasant.
review.reviewText:
Where do you start with this one...?

It's cheap, yes, and it's location is excellent - mid-way as it is between Downtown and Castro, and you get free wi-fi.

That's all the good points done...

The rest is sheer awfulness - it's one of those courtyard motels - so there's no real privacy. There are always people hanging around the courtyard and on the gangways and stairwells.

The walls are paper thin. You can hear EVERYTHING that's going on above you and either side. Everything.

Rooms often aren't cleaned and serviced until late in the afternoon. And it's never very clean after they've done. The bedding wasn't changed once during my stay of six nights and had cigarette burns.

It takes about 10 minutes for the hot water to run hot in the bathroom.

It is the worst place I have ever stayed. If moving hotels had been an option, I would have done it on day one.
review.locationRemarks:
-- The Castro is fun and vibrant - lots of bars, restaurants and cafés and colourful people about
-- Haight-Ashbury also has lots of places to eat and drink and is colourful too
-- Fisherman's Wharf and the Piers also have a lot to do and see

review.reviewText: This hotel (motel) is overpriced. This must be where the college kids and dingy people go to party. Don't stay here with your family like I did. Also, the hotel offers free wifi but good luck picking up the signal. The whole place is constructed of concrete block. You won't have any cell signal, either. They have a good cleaning crew; the restroom was clean but falling apart. Bottom line is I won't be staying here again.

review.title: TRAVELODGE THE CONVENIENT HOTELIN SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: Travelodge is conveniently located in an area where you only need to walk a few steps to the tram stop that conveniently drops you off on Union Square or the Fisherman's Wharf. It's accurate description of the location was not hard for the taxi drivers to locate.

review.title: Don't expect to sleep.
review.reviewText:
Thin walls, Loud neighbors.

The parking lot is short-term city parking, so there's activity, partying all night, or just sitting their car for 30 mins revving the motor, at 3am.

Room & accommodations are a bit run down for a travelodge, but acceptable considering the good proximity to downtown. Right on Market St with streetcars.

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText: No chance of getting any sleep with all the noise. Our room felt like we were put in a remodeled broom closet. The fee to park was a joke. Dont waste your money staying here.

review.title: San Francisco pretty good hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel, cleap, good price.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: It was okey for one night but not longer, they had a 11 Dollar parking fee it was to much.... and the front desk men was sooooooooooooooo unfriendly-!

review.title: nothing extraordinary but will do
review.reviewText: i needed a cheap place to stay in the city for a few days. hotel was ok since i was just looking for a place at which to sleep and wash up. rooms are "exposed" to the outside so environment tends to be noisy outside your door. but housekeeping did their job and counter staff was helpful. nice location since its close to downtown as well as mission/valencia/castro neighborhoods as well.

review.title: Not too bad. Great price.
review.reviewText: Good price, but too much noise from all the employers working in the am. Sleeping in on vacation is overrated :)

review.title: Not for kids. OK for thick-skinned travelers on a budget.
review.reviewText:
Travelodge risks its brand by keeping motels like this.

If you enjoyed the movie Blade Runner, you will feel at home in this hotel. Especially room 126.

The non-smoking double room was old-fashioned, with worn out furniture, heavily patched walls, re-hinged doors, and with a cold vinyl-asbestos tiled floor. The bathroom window looked out onto a rubbish filled alley that could keep a cleaning crew busy for a few hours. It was clear that some had smoked in there. I did not ask for another room, because I feared it could easily have been worse.

In the morning, homeless people were scanning the large trashcan about 6 feet from my door.

The advertised Free-Internet really meant Internet-Free, since the Wi-Fi was out 'for the evening'. That might be a regular feature of the place, who knows?

The sheets were so threadbare that I could read a newspaper through them. The pillows were beaten up. The thin blankets could have been from the 1970s and one would not have wanted them against one's skin.

I checked for bedbugs, and found none -- the mattresses had been specially sealed -- I was thankful for that, at least.

The bathroom had a modern tile finish, but the rest of the room was not up to the same standard.

Either the floor was thin, or the people upstairs were using pogo sticks. I managed a very poor rest, overall.

I was alone, and saving cash, so I did not make an issue. I would never take my kids there, nor recommend friends. Do it if you are desperate! Else, RUN!

review.title: Take it off your list
review.reviewText: The neighborhood is not nice. The guests were noisy, the hotel has no insolation, so every moove of people around you in other rooms can be heard.

review.title: Checked in but would not stay
review.reviewText:
This is not the place to bring your family.
The noise was very loud. The coming and going
At the next to us was not normal

review.title: Thomas
review.reviewText: En centre ville, chambre correcte, quartier super sympa mais un peu bruyant (pas mal de pub a cotes mais sinon je recommande pour le rapport qualite prix!

review.title: A great place in the middle of it all
review.reviewText: We didn't even move the car the whole stay. We took the metro and buses to all the sights in San Francisco. walking was the best because we found resturaunts teat eat at and the Maket was close.

review.title: BAD NIGHT CREW
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is perfect.The morning staff is GREAT. The NIGHT WORKER WAS EXTREMELY RUDE! I went to request extra pillows and was told by the Night check in person that "i had enought pillows and didnt need anymore". This made my stay/sleep extremely bad.

review.title: Convenient neighborhood and good value. Parking cheap for SF
review.reviewText: Can walk to hip area of Valencia St or to Castro area. Try Martunis bar across the street-it's both hip and swanky and has an interesting mix of people.

review.title: Troublelodge
review.reviewText: Ice and vending machine permanently unplugged. I was told it was due to renovations but I was told that 6 months ago and I can't see renovation

review.title: DO NOT BOOK HERE!
review.reviewText:
We were a group of minors going for a college visit we were reassured by the manager that there would be no problems for check-in we get there and the first thing they tell u is that we cant check-in because we werent 21 and that we would get refunded if we called expedia. We were hundreds of miles from home and no were to stay so after 30 minutes of debating with the front desk we were able to check-in to top it all off the hotel was SMALL, COLD, AND THE DOOR DIDNT LOCK!

There were homeless people walking around the hotel coming up to the 2nd floor people were loud breakfast was a piece of toast and watery orange juice. I also noticed that the breakfast was a "FREE FOR ALL" homeless men and woman came in to the lobby and took breakfast and walked out 3 or 4 people did this and they werent even checked in the hotel!!!!

review.title: Tricky Parking Fees
review.reviewText: Tiny room that smelled very strongly of cleaning products - in kid of a bad way. BUT - the room was extremely cheap & very conveniently locared. Still - threy handed us a parking pass for our two nights without mentioning that it was $12 plus tax a day to park. Signs were on the wall but - I believe - they should ask if you want parking even if it costs $12. Just handing a pass over without remark suggests it is included with the room.

review.title: It's close to where I need to be in San Francisco and on the "F" Streetcar line.
review.reviewText: The Travelodge is very convenient to the center of San Francisco and city shopping. And in my case it is close to my family's home.

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Well worth the price for such a convenient location

review.title: Pretty decent hotel
review.reviewText: I did not have any major complains with this hotel. The neighborhood is somewhat noisy but that is to be expected in this area of San Francisco. The hotel provided parking, which was very helpful. It was in the heart of several attractions that I wanted to visit and there were several good places to eat nearby. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: NOT GOOD
review.reviewText: The hotel charged me extral $72.46 for two days. I didnt rent a car, I dont know why. I will never go to this hotel.

review.title: Convenience
review.reviewText: It's for pure convenience and nothing else. I had reserved a non-smoking room with 2-double beds, but ended up with smoking 1-king bed room. Good thing my friend and didn't mind. Location is perfect for after partying and was very cheap.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: For this price and location, you can not ask for anything else.

review.title: Market Travelodge
review.reviewText:
Didn't expect a lot from a travelodge, but we requested a non-smoking room and the room reeked of smoke. The parking lot is tiny and if you leave and come back after everyone else, it's difficult to find a spot. The manager was directing people to park in front of the hotel, basically on the sidewalk.

However, the two places we went to that were close by were in walking distance, which was very convienent.

review.title: Will never return
review.reviewText:
I have never written a bad review but I was shocked by this hotel. Awful location. I did not feel safe getting dinner at night. I was also always worried that my rental car was going to be harmed or stolen.

Parking was nonexistent. They allowed people from everywhere to park therefore I rarely was able to have a space. At which point, they made me double park and relinquish my keys. At my own risk, they added.

Overall, the staff was surly, unfriendly and unhelpful. To get an iron for my business clothes, I had to give them $20!!!

And, all not teenagers were drinking, puking, playing music and "connecting" throughout the hotel. I was shocked this was a Travelodge.

review.title: Don't expect hospitality here --- they are doing a favor
review.reviewText: You have to understand that I stayed here many times, and this was my first time back in six months. The drapes are finally hung, but the rooms are cold, have no carpeting, and are very noisy because of the lack of insulation from carpeting. The staff is the same: housekeeping great, front desk average, general manager still thinks he is home and this is his kingdom. A confrontation with someone led to his going to the GM who provided 90% false statements causing me problems later that morning.

review.title: Way over price and not even worth one start
review.reviewText: This place is way over price and should not even on the search list...

review.title: Simple Yet Satisfying
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for here. Simple rooms for a great price. Location was great. Parking lot is very convenient. Did not partake in the free breakfast, but there was a large crowd that did.

review.title: Totally disappointed
review.reviewText: The front desk people was not really nice because when I check the room it was so small with a queen bed and saw that it wast'n the king size bed that i reserve, they told me that i have to call expedia to make any complaint because that wast'n their fault.

review.title: In San Francisco, you apparently get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: This is the cheapest hotel that shows up if you search the Union Square area. I have been to DC, NY, Chicago, Las Vegas, even Baltimore, but I have never seen streets so choked with junkies, prostitutes, and the REALLY destitute homeless- sneakers sticking out from sleeping bags on the street types. There was a construction zone right outside going on all day and most of the night, I literally stepped on a rat the size of my shoe scurrying around the outside of the motel, and when my vibrating phone failed to wake me after relating these conditions to my wife, she had the most frantic meltdown I have ever seen in our years together, fearing for my safety. I also counted, if I remember correctly, at least 17 separate holes in the bedspread.

review.title: Do not recommend it.
review.reviewText: Overall, I was not happy with the hotel and the service. It was not at the usual level of Travelodge and of the hotels featured on Expedia.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: not impressed

review.title: Travelodge Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Nothing special, but a convenient hotel if you don´t have a place yet where to sleep through the night.

Location may not be the best, but it´s still very convenient.

review.title: Near the Castro
review.reviewText: Decent place to stay if you want to be near the Castro. Totally worth it for the price if you book on-line thru here! Was totally comfy and will be staying here again when in city..

review.title: Convenient location to Hayes Valley, The Mission and the Castro
review.reviewText: very courteous staff! efficient and pleasant! Accommodations are basic but comfortable.

review.title: Best Travel Bargain in San Francisco
review.reviewText: For all the amenties (safe, refrigerator, coffee maker, free continental breakfast) you can't beat it for the price. Right on Market street, close to public transportation, with a laundry, convience store and popular free-mike bar across the street. Within walking distance of civic center and many fine resturants.

review.title: European review
review.reviewText:
Nice comfortable place, situated in between all touristic areas and nearby downtown. Walking distance to bus & cablecar. If you like to walk you can walk everywhere because its central! Confortabel bed and a nice place to have a rest during the day too.
Not much of a (continental??) breakfast but Who Cares!

review.title: Wouldn't let my dog sleep here.
review.reviewText: The room was dirty. (cleaned the floors myself) Safe didn't work. Staff was intrusive (even though "Do not disturb" sign was posted), and cold. It was loud. I got no sleep, and didn't feel comfortable sleeping under the comforter, after finding a cap to a syringe in the room. On check-out, I was asked to wait for them to inspect the room as if I could have made the room worse. If your into late night partying without the expectation of sleep then this is the place for you.

review.title: i would have rather stayed in my car!!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at travlerslodges in the past and never had too much of an issue. However, this hotel/motel was amazingly HORRIBLE!! aside from having to put a deposit down for parking and a deposit for MY IRON!!! yes that is correct a deposit for an iron.. the bed sheet that was tacked up over the window to make a curtain was somewhat of an eye-sore. however what really put this over the top was the "activities" going on the the room next to me i could have sworn it was a brothel!! do not stay here pay the extra ten dollars and save yourself the headache.

review.title: Central and perfect if not spending time at the hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is clean, but not remodeled, so don't expect Hilton treatment. Staff was nice and polite, continental breakfast was basise.
This hotel is perfectly situated within blocks of Union Squarte, great restaurants nearby, open air produce market just down the road.

Very close to the highway if you need to get out of the city, reasonably priced, great location

review.title: Exaggerated proximity
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I stayed here for her birthday. We were looking for a cheap, however, quality hotel to stay in the heart of San Francisco. This hotel advertised as such. In terms of quality, there are no major complaints. The staff there do not go over the top to provide cleanliness and comfort but the room was clean enough to sleep. In terms of location, you can likely get a place closer for not much more. Good walk to all main attractions. Biggest disappointment was the number of homeless people near the hotel. San Fran has alot, and a good portion are within a couple blocks of here. If you don't mind walking and just want a place to crash, its not bad.

review.title: Terrible!
review.reviewText: We booked a non-smoking room on the top floor with a king-sized bed and received a smoking room on the bottom floor with a full-sized bed. The smell was so intense it actually WOKE ME UP multiple times throughout the night. There were no CURTAINS on the windows! -the bedsheet that was stapled to the wall still allowed all the morning light to destroy our sleep while providing a shadow puppet show for all our neighbors at night. There was no carpeting, absolutely no insulation, no heater, and no A/C. A space heater was loud and ineffective, and although I slept with ear plugs in, it was impossible to sleep after 7 a.m. due to the noise level. I will never stay here again but I will highly recommend this place to people I hate.

review.title: no way i would recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: very noisy, i could not find parking space (but i paid for it)...not a really good location- one block down bad neighborhood

review.title: Noisy & too active
review.reviewText: The first indication of a problem was the lobby was locked and we had to do all our dealings through a night window at 6.30pm in daylight. Felt like some kind of rent by the hour motel. Asked for room in back and king bed, got one in very front w/ queen bed. Insisted on changing and had party central upstairs. 2am re-arranging all furniture, smoking outside of their doors, loud talking. I used to recommend this place because of proximity to many things, BUT... not sure I would recommend it now that I've stayed there. Too bad. It could be alot better.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: we specifically requsted a Non-smoking room, and was given a smoking room and was not pleased with the bad odor or the lingering smell of smoke all night long. I have to say, we frequently stay in a travel lodge motels and this last stay was by far the worst.

review.title: It's alright if you're in a budget.
review.reviewText: Hotel was k but what I didn't like was the fact that we had to pay for parking. That sucked!

review.title: nice location excellent price, pretty clean, but not much else
review.reviewText: We were promised a non-smoking room with a king-sized bed. We got a room with a non-smoking sign by the door, but it reeked of cigarettes and the worn-out blankets on the full-sized bed featured a number of cigarette burns. The tiny room -- yes, barely room for the bed and our suitcases -- was probably once a janitor's closet, located as it was way back in the darkest corner with a window that looked out over the dumpsters. No curtains on the windows (due to renovations, the sign said) but instead a thin sheet stapled to the wall that did not keep the morning sun from shining directly into our eyes at the crack of dawn. Overall, not a pleasant place, except that it is centrally located, walking distance to some great neighborhoods and the parking is unbelievably inexpensive. Maybe if you can get a real room rather than a converted closet, this place would be acceptable for the price.

review.title: DISGUSTING, RUDE OWNER
review.reviewText: I would never go back to this hotel, EVER! The room was disgusting . There was blood stains on the sheets, there was a hole in the floor under the carpet, the room smelled bad and there was no air conditioning. The owner was very rude to us when we checked out as well. DO NOT GO HERE!!

review.title: The Roach Motel!
review.reviewText: The worst hotel we ever stay at. There was a blanket over the window for a curtain, the bathroom door didn't close, and you could hear every little sound from the surrounding rooms. It seemed like there was only one person running the motel who had less than perfect people skills. The rooms were so disqusting I told my kids to just sleep ontop of the covers with their clothes on. Do not here at any cost!

review.title: good value, clean, bland hotel, not exclusive but good enough
review.reviewText: we stay for 3 days in san francisco and it was good enogh for our to satisfy claims, it was verry clean, the breakfest was simple but ok. against the information, that there is free parking, we have to pay 11 $ for 1 night parkingfee.

review.title: Good enough for what/where it is
review.reviewText: The only thing wrong with this place is something they can't help: it's in a noisy (and a bit seedy) area. But good prices, free breakfast & wireless, and room was clean. If you're not the nervous type, just wear earplugs and you'll be fine. Too far from Union Square to walk but the trolleys run often and cheaply.

review.title: It was worth the price!
review.reviewText: Even though the room was on the in-expensive side, I didn't get what i was suppose to. I get a full size bed when I was suppose to get a King and the front desk man acted dump when I confronted him on the matter. There was no A/C in the room, just a small wall fan and the room smelled like it was freshly painted. The fumes gave me a headache. They put me in a disabled persons room with everything designed for a wheelchair person. Im a guy of 6'4 and it was rough. They stated they had no more rooms. DONT BOTHER WITH THIS HOTEL! Spend the extra money and get a well equipped place with great customer service!

review.title: Good Hotel if on a Budget
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and smelled of bleach so i knew it was well cleaned. The paint in the room is a very bright yellow, but was freshely painted and renovated. The only thing was we had a problem with the plug behind the bed and it began to spark so I unplugged the lamps. When reported to the front desk they immediately fixed it. The only thing was when checking out we asked for luggage storage and they charged us an extra $10.00. Seems like they were trying to squeeze every cent out of us that they could.

review.title: If you sleep lightly don't stay here!
review.reviewText: Recently stayed at this hotel, on a urgent medically related trip. Under all the stress of the trip circumstances, the hotel also added more on top of what was already there. I barely slept as there was continuous noise. I am a very hard sleeper and it woke me quite frequently. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! Pay the extra money and stay at a more upscale facility!!!

review.title: u get what u pay for
review.reviewText: title sums it up. one other thing; there's renovations going on right now (dec 2008) which i was not aware of.

review.title: Affordable accomodation.
review.reviewText: Good location . Clean and comfortable will be staying there on my next trip.

review.title: rude staff and rough neighbourhood
review.reviewText: very dissapointed - worst motel that we stayed in during a 2 week trip of USA and canada. The room was ok - but the keys didn't work very well, had small double beds and no air conditioning. The staff were very slow and rude. It's a good half an hour walk to central SF and the neighbourhood is pretty rough.

review.title: nice enough but expensive
review.reviewText: The room was OK... we paid 189/night which seemed like way too much for a motel, but was all that was left during outside lands. Good location - close to bus stops to get to haight and GG Park.

review.title: Small rooms
review.reviewText: The room with 2 queen beds was not big enough for more than 2 adults. A lot of noise from the street, but that must be expected in a big city. Very close to Union Square and about 30 minutes walk to the Piers.

review.title: great location for cheap
review.reviewText: this was a fun one day trip i took up into the city and this hotel served its purpose. it is in a very central location. i had a great time.

review.title: Grouchy staff
review.reviewText: I wanted to check in early, the lady at the counter gave me the impression that they do not need me as a customer because they are fully booked and they could not accommodate my request for early check in. I overheard a couple behind me at the desk that they have bed bug bites and was planning on getting their money money back to move to other hotels.

review.title: Just okay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good price for the city. You get what you pay for.

review.title: ITSADUMP
review.reviewText: Excellent DT location for walkers. Questionable neighbourhood. No services. Dreadful breakfast. Good WiFi. Varied clientelle: kids, tourists, business people. Many strange looking people coming and going. Good price point.

review.title: december in san francisco
review.reviewText: on a very busy street. not really clean, very small room for two adult and two kids.

review.title: Best Value in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Centrally located on Market street. Vintage trolly car just steps from the Hotel take you almost anywhere.

review.title: Didn't Sleep A Wink
review.reviewText: This hotel looked decent from the outside, however inside, the rooms were disgusting. The Carpets were filthy, the bathroom had mold growing in it, the room was hot and no air conditioning, and to top it all off the mattress was covered in plastic, making it noisy and hot. I will never stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Just what we needed!!!
review.reviewText: On a warm (for SF) 4th of July day spent at the Wharf, topped off by a beautiful fire works display, it was a pleasure to crawl into a big, comfy, king-sized bed! Thank goodness the hotel had a built-in oscillating fan in our room which made sleeping very comfortable.

review.title: Stay at another facility
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a seedy section of town with lots of traffic noise and multitudes of homeless people. The occupants of the hotel are loud and inconsiderate, staff is passive-agressive at best, and and the shower did not work. The room was relatively clean although the carpet looked dirty and worn. I would recommend staying at another facility regardless of price.

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: This hotel was supposed to have a king bed, but it was a double! The room size and bathroom size was adequate but the set up was not good AND you had to pay for parking in the parking lot. The cashier was behind a cage; not worth the money. I would NOT go back.

review.title: It Did the Job
review.reviewText: A budget Travelodge - 2 stars max. Best value mid-week otherwise tending way over-priced Friday and weekend. Being at the upper end of Market Street (NOT central as in cablecar) it is a 30 minute walk to cablecar terminus. There are a couple of awesomely good eateries very close.

review.title: Great deal!
review.reviewText: Was very pleased for the price of this hotel. I've stayed there twice now and find it to be located close to interesting neighboorhoods as well as Davies Hall and the Orpheum Theatre. It was relatively quiet for a weekend. YOu can park your car in their lot for an extra $10, but best not to arrive too late as they may run our of spaces. Public transport very close by.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: Old hotel, could use a paint job, some repair and either new or deep steam cleaned carpets. Close to Castor and Civic Center on Market and Valencia. Can't beat the price. The staff does what it can to accomadate but the parent corp needs to cough up some bucks but have a feeling the rates would go through the roof too. Pretty full every night so make reservations.

review.title: Practical - It is what it is
review.reviewText: I like this place, stay there often. It is safe, clean, and practical for those of us who watch our bucks. It is not an upscale place for those who need luxury. You may notice some wear and tear. The location is ideal for my purposes; it should be for many visitors. One usually does not need a car in San Francisco. If you are comfortable with public transportation, this place is ideal situated. There is no air conditioning. I am an off and on San Franciscan; one does not expect air conditioning there. Most places do not have it. It is rare to even consider wanting air conditioning in the City at night. One will encounter street people at Market and Valencia. Many are homeless; they have been there seemingly forever; they are not dangerous. I do not find any of the street people to be in any way intimidating or troubling. However, visitors who might be concerned, know who they are and should be advised. Regardless, any visitor should be street wise in any big city. Street noises are also a reality. This place is a three story motel at an extraordinary busy location. It does not bother me; I am a city person; I sleep through it. People who would be sensitive to 24 hour activity should be advised. Bottom line: I will stay there anytime.

review.title: Small rooms, funky neighborhood
review.reviewText: My king bed room had perhaps two feet on each side to get around it. Cont. brekfast was danish and coffee. Many things you don't want to buy were for sale, all night long, in this area. Still, cheap and convenient location to lots of stuff. They xerox your driver's license when you check in, which I hate, esp. when room is prepaid.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: For the hotels age it was well maintained and showed signs of improvements. The one thing I did discover is that carpets need to steam cleaned (my white sox got almost black just walking the room). The hotel location was great for my trips to the Castro neighborhood and downtown San Francisco. It was really special due to being on the F line and having all the restored street cars to ride on. What is great about the hotel location and San Francisco in general is the public transportation system and that you really don't need a car!

review.title: Good value-Great location
review.reviewText: This is a value priced hotel and is conveniently located . I believe they refurbished the rooms a couple of years ago as I had stayed there before they re-did the place. The room and bathroom were clean. Parking is a little tough even though you pay to park, I finally had to park in front of the dumpster per the desk clerks' direction. You'll need to remember you are not at a 3 star or better property but for the price in S.F. it is a good deal.

review.title: Average, but a strategic location.
review.reviewText: Average point but since the location is located in the mid of San Francisco, it will make easy access for traveller who has no private transportation.

review.title: Lots of outside noise!
review.reviewText: Very busy street and lots of people walking around the hotel being loud.

review.title: It will do.
review.reviewText: I had a satisfactory experience with this hotel. It's central location is excellent. The front desk staff were rude and pushy but met my requests when pushed. I spent one night in the non-smoking wing and three nights in the smoking wing. In the non-smoking room I found that the walls were extremely thin as I heard coughing and other noises quite clearly. The walls also seemed thin in the smoking zone but not quite as bad, perhaps I just had better neighbours. In both rooms the bed and bathrooms were clean but the doors and walls were not. Things that were easy to clean with a quick wipe were not. There seemed to be plenty of hot water in the non-smoking wing but there was little available in the smoking wing. I tried a couple of times to have a bath in the late evening and could barely achieve a luke- warm temperature. In the morning it was fine when I bathed in the mid to late morning.There is a nice laundromat across the street which is handy. It is close enough to walk to the Bill Graham Civic Aud. If you like to walk uphill it is also relatively close to the beautiful Buena Vista Park.It is not the safest neighbourhood but I never had any trouble when visiting stores very late at night.There is lots of transit available nearby and cabs are generally easy to find on Market St. I received my wake up call on time and there is also an alarm clock in the room.

review.title: Be cautious!
review.reviewText: This MOTEL is in a part of SF called MISSION. This is not a nice part of town it is very unsavory. We were due to stay 4 nights, we stayed 1, we felt unsafe and very unsecure. There is no overnight security and the rooms frontdoor are open to the people and elements of SF.

review.title: Walking distance to civic center
review.reviewText: The proximity of the hotel to the Bill Graham Civic Center allowed me to walk to my convention every morning which I liked because driving in San Francisco is a nightmare. Be aware that the surrounding area houses an incredible amount of homeless people. The room itself is decent, but without the fan running all night the room becomes an oven. Also note that you will be charged $12 to park your car in the hotel lot.

review.title: Two Night Stay or Less
review.reviewText: Ok place to stay for a few nights to party in San Fran. Great location for those who like to party in the Castro District.

review.title: Location's Great
review.reviewText: Halfway between town and Castro; very close to F line on Market which takes you downtown in minutes.

review.title: At least they offer parking
review.reviewText: This hotel room was very small with very little room to move around. The showers were great, good water pressure. They only allowed a 30 minute late check out in the morning which was really inconvienant for me. A huge plus is that they had a parking lot that you could pay a small fee with in and outs allowed. This is great for San Francisco, this parking situation was the best part about the stay.

review.title: Enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Travelodge On Market Street.It was clean and very quiet at night.

review.title: not keen
review.reviewText: it is central, but a bit grotty and basic. a lot of noise too . coming and going all night. no kettle in rooms no air conditioning either. ok for a one nighter but no more!

review.title: Many recent improvements
review.reviewText: Hotel has done a lot of work in recent months to improve the decor of the rooms. Wireless was working well on last visit. Desk staff is somewhat brusque, defensive and inattentive, but the cleaning staff is professional and thorough.

review.title: You have to know before...
review.reviewText: No AC / Not really cheap / don't expect anything from the front desk / don't use the airport shuttle service they recommend except if you want to have a free tour around San Francisco (lost 3 times)and arrive after the check in deadline... Rooms are spacious and very clean for the category.

review.title: Centrally located, I would go back.
review.reviewText: Close to public transportation. There is no AC but a fan is provided. The only negative is the parking lot was not big enough to hold all of the cars, and they should when they charge an additional fee of ten dollars plus tax for each day you stay.

review.title: Recommended as a good place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel only one night. The room was nice but a little small. They charged 10 dollars extra for parking. The breakfast was just a danish pastry and that's it. It was a nice place, clean, friendly nice neighbourhood, close to everything. I would stay again.

review.title: Great location, great price, great quality
review.reviewText: The location and price really can't be beat. This is the second time I've stayed there, and it is definitely centrally located. Midway between Union Square and Castro district (easily walking distance). Right on the street car and bus lanes. Close to a major grocery store.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very good, friendly staff and helpful. Its far from the center if you walk, but you can buy (and its recommended) a daily ride ticket and you can use it for all the buses and rails (which you must a ticket if you want to go to all the high lights of the city)

review.title: Difficult to get to and noisy
review.reviewText: This hotel i fould was nice, clean and comfortable. However it is right off Market street which was really noisy. I also found it really difficut to get to because driving on Market street is not so easy with all the no turns and such.

review.title: It is what it is
review.reviewText: If you want to do a night out in SF and don't feel like driving back to wherever you're from, this hotel offers a basic place to crash. The furnishings in our room were clean/new enough, but the structure itself had some issues. Our ceiling had large water spots and was flaking, and the bathroom door was difficult to close and did not lock. There was also an obvious "spot" on the wall that the maid should and could have clean off, but didn't. The free breakfast was completely put away slighty before the advertised end time of 9 a.m. Who is up that early? Nobody! Finally, they advertise that they are three blocks from the Castro District, which might be true if you were measuring from the very edge. However, it is a pretty good hike from the center of the district, Market and Castro Streets. I can only suggest this hotel because 1) it is the second closest to the Castro and 2) there are worse hotels.

review.title: Wonderful for the price
review.reviewText: I'd go back to this hotel in a minute - despite it being a bit worn, the chair in my room wobbly, and a good bit of outside noise at bar closing time: 1) the price was unbeatable 2) the staff were wonderful 3) it was very clean. I'd also recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Good location, price
review.reviewText: When traveling alone as I did this trip, I look for value, location, safety, cleanliness, and convenience to airport, tourist attractions, museums, public transportation and gay interests. I stayed here last time I was in SF and it fills my needs. The area is a bit rough to walk in at night, but cabs are cheap. Other methods of public transportation are close by. The only real complaint was there was no A/C, but this is the norm in the city except for much higher priced properties. I stayed in a 4 star hotel on Nob Hill once with no A/C. Just didn't expect 80 degree days in SF in the middle of February. Morning coffee OK, but breakfast consisted of individually packaged danish rolls.

review.title: Far away by walk from the business center (1st ~ 7th on Market)
review.reviewText: First, it's far away, if you walk, from the real SF business center for shoppings, conferences, etc. Their hotel description tells you it's 9 blocks away from the city center, but this 9 blocks are HUGE! At least 45 minutes walk! Don't get misled! Rooms are OK and the price is pretty good if you book early. We had a toilet leakage problem which made a lot of mess, and this becomes the reason of my unfavorable ratings here.

review.title: Bad Service, Bad Room !!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, but the service was bad and the room was in bad shape. I requested a King size bed in a non smoking room, but the room I recieved was a non-smoking two bed room that smelled like smoke. If that wasn't bad enough at night a constent dripping sound could be heard in the corner of the room as if there were a water leak some where. Horrible expierence!!! The rates are cheap, but if you want to sleep, go to another hotel.

review.title: it was ok!!
review.reviewText: It was easy to find and in the center of everything.
